comments:
Classic L-System Grammars

A collection of well-known L-systems for demonstration.
Each showcases different aspects of the formalism:

  - Algae: Lindenmayer's original, simplest growth pattern
  - Dragon: Space-filling fractal from paper folding
  - Koch: Snowflake/curve, classic fractal
  - Sierpinski: Triangle fractal
  - FractalPlant: Bracketed, organic branching
  - Hilbert: Space-filling, locality-preserving

declarations.comments:
The original L-system from Lindenmayer's 1968 paper.
Models algae cell division.

A represents a mature cell, B a young cell.
Mature cells produce young cells; young cells mature.

Iteration 0: A
Iteration 1: AB
Iteration 2: ABA
Iteration 3: ABAAB
Iteration 4: ABAABABA

The length follows the Fibonacci sequence!
declarations.title: algae

declarations.comments:
The Dragon Curve (Heighway Dragon).
Created by folding a strip of paper repeatedly.

F = draw forward
+ = turn left
- = turn right

Forms a space-filling fractal with no self-intersection.
declarations.title: dragonCurve

declarations.comments:
Koch Curve - the basis of the Koch Snowflake.
Each straight segment is replaced by a kinked version.

Start with a line, add a triangular bump in the middle.
Repeat infinitely â†’ infinite length, finite area.
declarations.title: kochCurve

declarations.comments: Koch Snowflake - three Koch curves forming a closed shape.
declarations.title: kochSnowflake

declarations.comments:
Sierpinski Triangle (arrowhead variant).
One of the classic fractals.
declarations.title: sierpinskiTriangle

declarations.comments:
A simple fractal plant with branching.

[ = save position and angle (push)
] = restore position and angle (pop)

This creates organic-looking branching structures.
declarations.title: fractalPlant

declarations.comments:
Hilbert Curve - space-filling with locality preservation.
Points close in the 1D sequence are close in 2D.
Useful for database indexing, image processing.
declarations.title: hilbertCurve

declarations.comments: Peano Curve - the original space-filling curve (1890).
declarations.title: peanoCurve

declarations.comments: All classic L-systems in order of complexity.
declarations.title: classicLSystems

name: Zoo.LSystem.Grammar
